statement.p: Let \displaystyle{C}_{{1}} be a circle of radius \displaystyle{0.01} centered at the origin in the \displaystyle{x}{y}-plane, oriented counterclockwise when viewed from the positive \displaystyle{z}-axis. Estimate the circulation around \displaystyle{C}_{{1}}.

Let \displaystyle{C}_{{2}} be a circle of radius \displaystyle{0.01} centered at the origin in the \displaystyle{y}{z}-plane, oriented counterclockwise when viewed from the positive \displaystyle{x}-axis. Estimate the circulation around \displaystyle{C}_{{2}}.

Let \displaystyle{C}_{{3}} be a circle of radius \displaystyle{0.01} centered at the origin in the \displaystyle{x}{z}-plane, oriented counterclockwise when viewed from the positive \displaystyle{y}-axis. Estimate the circulation around \displaystyle{C}_{{3}}.

solution.p: The circulation density of a smooth vector field \displaystyle\vec{{{F}}} at a point \displaystyle{\left({x},{y},{z}\right)} around the direction of a unit vector \displaystyle\vec{{{n}}} is defined by \displaystyle\text{circ}_{{\vec{{{n}}}}}\ \vec{{{F}}}{\left({x},{y},{z}\right)}=\lim_{{\text{Area}\rightarrow{0}}}{\frac{{\int_{{C}}\vec{{{F}}}\cdot{d}\vec{{{r}}}}}{{\text{Area}\ \text{inside}\ {C}}}}.

Since \displaystyle{C}_{{1}} is a small circle centerd at \displaystyle{\left({0},{0}\right)} in the \displaystyle{x}{y}-plane, oriented counterclockwise, we can estimate the circulation \displaystyle\int_{{{C}_{{1}}}}\vec{{{F}}}\cdot{d}\vec{{{r}}} by using the \displaystyle\vec{{{k}}} component of \displaystyle\text{curl}\ \vec{{{F}}}. So, the circulation around \displaystyle{C}_{{1}} is given by \displaystyle\int_{{{C}_{{1}}}}\vec{{{F}}}\cdot{d}\vec{{{r}}}\approx\text{circ}_{{\vec{{{k}}}}}\ \vec{{{F}}}{\left({0},{0},{0}\right)}\cdot{\left(\text{Area}\ \text{inside}\ {C}_{{1}}\right)} \displaystyle={\left(\text{curl}\ \vec{{{F}}}{\left({0},{0},{0}\right)}\cdot\vec{{{k}}}\right)}{\left(\text{Area}\ \text{inside}\ {C}_{{1}}\right)} \displaystyle={4}\cdot\pi\cdot{\left({0.01}\right)}^{{2}}=\displaystyle{0.00004}\pi.

Similarly, we estimate the circulation \displaystyle\int_{{{C}_{{2}}}}\vec{{{F}}}\cdot{d}\vec{{{r}}} by using \displaystyle\text{circ}_{{\vec{{{i}}}}}\ \vec{{{F}}}{\left({0},{0},{0}\right)}. So, the circulation around \displaystyle{C}_{{2}} is given by \displaystyle\int_{{{C}_{{2}}}}\vec{{{F}}}\cdot{d}\vec{{{r}}}\approx\text{circ}_{{\vec{{{i}}}}}\ \vec{{{F}}}{\left({0},{0},{0}\right)}\cdot{\left(\text{Area}\ \text{inside}\ {C}_{{2}}\right)} \displaystyle={\left(\text{curl}\ \vec{{{F}}}{\left({0},{0},{0}\right)}\cdot\vec{{{i}}}\right)}{\left(\text{Area}\ \text{inside}\ {C}_{{2}}\right)} \displaystyle=-{2}\cdot\pi\cdot{\left({0.01}\right)}^{{2}}=\displaystyle-{0.00002}\pi.
